meanings.definition: To surpass in number of people.
meanings.sent1: The small town was outpeopled by the bustling city nearby.
meanings.sent2: The city outpeopled the village as more and more families moved in.
meanings.sent3: The race to outpeopling each other in the game of tag was intense.
meanings.sent4: The forest outpeopled with animals as the seasons changed.
meanings.sent5: The school outpeopled with students eager to learn new things.

meanings.definition: The act of exceeding in population.
meanings.sent1: The outpeopling of the city led to overcrowded streets.
meanings.sent2: The outpeopling of the town brought new challenges to the community.
meanings.sent3: The outpeopling of the zoo made it a popular destination for families.
meanings.sent4: The outpeopling of the park during the festival created a lively atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The outpeopling of the school resulted in the need for more classrooms.

meanings.definition: To outdo in terms of population growth.
meanings.sent1: The neighboring town was outpeopling their town with new housing developments.
meanings.sent2: The company was outpeopling its competitors by attracting more employees.
meanings.sent3: The garden was outpeopling the flower bed with its colorful blooms.
meanings.sent4: The city was outpeopling the suburbs with its rapid expansion.
meanings.sent5: The community center was outpeopling other venues with its exciting events.
